item.description:
Well, it's the big day!  Unfortunately, mother nature didn't read these posts.  It is supposed to rain most of the day.  So... I'm going to alter our day a little bit and try to keep us inside as much as possible.  (But bring an umbrella for the jogs between buildings.)

New schedule:

  • Eat a hearty breakfast, or bring a snack.  We may not have time to eat before 2:30.
  • About 10am - Catch the bus from your house to Kennedy Plaza.  Please see the site below for time schedules.  Send me a message if you'd like assistance.

http://www.ripta.com/schedules/schedules.php

  • 10:45 - 11:15  Meet at Providence train station
  • 11:20 - 12:25  Take the MBTA train from Providence to Back Bay
  • 12:25 - 12:45  Take the Orange line from Back Bay to Ruggles
  • 12:45 - 1:00  Walk from the T stop to the Museum of Fine Arts(MFA)
  • 1:00 - 2:30  Tour the Chihuly glass exhibit (It may not take us this whole time.  If we get done early, it will move up the rest of the schedule.)
  • 2:30 - 3:30  Late lunch at the MFA
  • Open time.  Let's brainstorm on this.  Here are a few options:

- Under the Sea 3D movie @ the Aquarium from 4:00 - 4:40

- Stop for a drink somewhere before dinner

- Open to other ideas.  What do you think?

  • 5:00 - 6:00 Dinner @ Mare in the North End.  I decided to move up our dinner time in order to snag a table at this fantastic restaurant.  It's my favorite in the North End.  This is the only time they were available, though.  So, in light of the rain, let's opt for better food!
  • From here the world is our play ground... our wet, soggy play ground.  But!  We WILL have fun!  ;-)

 

See you soon,

Stephanie

 

Update #3 - 6/7/11

It's almost time for our fun day in Boston! I hope you're as excited as I am!

It looks like we're in for some three digit temperatures this week.  Yikes!  The good news is it should be cool and dry for our trip, with temps in the 60s/70s.  Perfect for walking around town and not being a sweaty mess.

We'll be sticking to the schedule I laid out on 5/8, and I've filled times in below.

***Please send me a message ASAP to let me know when you will be joining and departing the group.***  This will help me plan the day better, as I will need a head-count for some of our activities.  Most importantly: 1) Will you be joining us for the Chihuly exhibit? 2) Will you be joining us for dinner in the North End?  If I don't hear from you, I can't make a reservation for you.

Update #2 - 5/8/11

The weather is getting warmer, the trees are flowering, the birds are chirping, and I am getting excited about our trip to Boston!

Here is a quick outline of our day:

  • Eat a hearty breakfast, or bring a snack.  We may not have time to eat before 2:30.
  • About 10am - Catch the bus from your house to Kennedy Plaza.  Please see the site below for time schedules.  Send me a message if you'd like assistance.

http://www.ripta.com/schedules/schedules.php

  • 10:45 - 11:15 Meet at Providence train station
  • 11:20 - 12:25 Take the MBTA train from Providence to Back Bay
  • 12:25 - 12:45 Take the Orange line from Back Bay to Ruggles
  • 12:45 - 1:00 Walk from the T stop to the Museum of Fine Arts(MFA)  (The group entrance is on the North side of the building, off of Fenway)
  • 1:00 - 2:30 Tour the Chihuly glass exhibit (It may not take us this whole time.  If we get done early, it will move up the rest of the schedule.)
  • 2:30 - 3:30 Late lunch at the MFA
  • 3:30 - 4:00 Take the Green line from MFA to Arlington
  • 4:00 - 4:30 Public Garden, Swan Boats, Boston Common, Frog Pond (The Swan Boats stop at 4pm, so if we can get there earlier we'll take a ride.  If not, we'll keep on truckin')
  • 4:30 - 5:00 Follow part of the Freedom Trail to Faneuil Hall with a couple of pauses along the way.
  • 5:00 - 5:30 Spend time exploring Faneuil Hall (Use restrooms, etc.)
  • 5:30 - 6:00 Continue along Freedom Trail from Faneuil Hall to the North End
  • 6:30 - 8:00 Dinner in North End
  • 8:00 - 8:30 Walk to South Station
  • 8:45 - 9:50 Take the MBTA train from Back Bay to Providence
  • 10:00 Take RIPTA bus from Kennedy Plaza to your home

Another alternative is to stay in Boston for late-night shenanigans.  These will not be part of the official meetup, but everyone is welcome to join in.  Details for this will be a little less scheduled, and a little more on the fly.

The next (after the 8:45) and final Providence bound MBTA train leaves South Station at 11:10pm.  There is also a Peter Pan Bus from South Station to Kennedy Plaza departing at 6, 8, 10, and 11pm.

Stops along the Freedom Trail

- Boston Common

- Site of First Public School

- Old South Meeting House

- Boston Massacre Site

- Old State House

- Faneuil Hall 

- Paul Revere House

- Old North Church

 

You can break off from the group if you'd like and then meet back up with us again.  If you'd like any help scheduling side trips, let me know.  I can make suggestions and give you a map navigate your side trip before you leave us.  If you do choose to have a side trip, it would be great if you could meet back with us in time for dinner.

See you soon!

 

Update #1 - 3/25/11

Just received confirmation from the MFA that we have a reservation:

Saturday, June 11, 1:00pm

More details and updates to follow!

 

Original message - 3/22/11

Boston can be a difficult city to navigate, both for locals and for those of us who are new to the area.  We'll take the guess work out of navigating the city, and see some great sites along the way!

 

(Details will be filled in as I'm able to coordinate activities.)

I'M LOOKING FOR SUGGESTIONS!!!

  • Activities I'm contemplating:  
    • Chihuly glass exhibit at MFA ($20, possible discount)
    • Walking tour of Boston Common (free)
    • Abbreviated version of the freedom trail (free)
    • Boat ride to Charlestown Navy Yard ($3.40 roundtrip)
    • Dinner in the North End (pending reservations; $20-$40)
    • Evening shenanigans (for well-behaved shenanigan veterans only; there will be no babysitting of grown adults)
    • Hotel reservations for those wishing to stay over ($175-225 depending on what I can negotiate).

You can join and leave the tour as you'd like.  I will also give suggestions for side trips if you'd like to see other parts of Boston, and not stick with the group.  And, I will help you plan the transportation for your customized excursion.

  •  Directions will include how to utilize public transportation including:
    • The bus from your house to Kennedy Plaza in Providence
    •  The train (departs close to Kennedy Plaza) from Providence to Boston
    • The T (subway) and bus system around Boston
    • and back home again.

This will be a lot to plan, so I'm looking for your suggestions and help about what to include.  Details will become clearer as we get closer to the date.
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet at the Providence train station, and at various stops in Boston during the day.
item.why: Boston can be a difficult city to navigate, both for locals and for those of us who are new to the area. We'll take the guess work out of navigating the city, and see some great sites along the way!
item.name: Day trip to BOSTON: Chihuly glass exhibit at the MFA and more!
